meanings.definition: A unit of computer memory equal to 4,096 bytes.
meanings.sent1: My computer can store many pictures because it has a lot of ecads.
meanings.sent2: The new hard drive has a capacity of 500 ecads.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally spilled coffee on my computer, and now it thinks it has extra ecads!
meanings.sent4: Her brain felt like it had reached its ecads limit after studying for hours.
meanings.sent5: The ecads in the computer were like tiny boxes holding information.

meanings.definition: A unit of computer memory equal to 8,192 bytes.
meanings.sent1: The game required more ecads than my old computer could handle.
meanings.sent2: The new laptop has a storage capacity of 1000 ecads.
meanings.sent3: I dreamt that my pillow was filled with ecads instead of feathers!
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a library with shelves full of ecads of memories.
meanings.sent5: The ecads in the device were like small containers storing data.

meanings.definition: A unit of computer memory equal to 16,384 bytes.
meanings.sent1: The software needed at least 2000 ecads to run smoothly.
meanings.sent2: The external hard drive has a massive storage of 10,000 ecads.
meanings.sent3: I joked that my brain must have extra ecads because I remembered everything.
meanings.sent4: His brain was like a supercomputer with ecads of processing power.
meanings.sent5: The ecads in the system were like tiny soldiers holding data securely.
